results.brief_description: Directed and shot by Lars Von Trier, this one-take music video features the artists from Danish electro group Laid Back playing their instruments while sky-diving.

results.title: Bail up! The Bushranger on Australia's silent screen (1906-1928)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This is a selection of fragments and scenes from the only known surviving silent titles of Australias bushranger films which, in the silent years of our cinema, were both prolific and popular. They were a distinctive genre and a significant part of our cultural heritage. But by 1912, censorship bans, provoked by ideas of law and order and morality, effectively robbed Australian moviegoers of a national screen identity. We were then to be culturally colonised by the Hollywood cowboy. This video contains selections from the only known surviving silent narrative titles: Kelly Gang 1906 ; The Story of the Kelly Gang 1906 and 1910 re-release ; Thunderbolt 1910 ; Trooper Campbell 1914 ; The Kelly Gang 1920 ; Robbery under arms 1920 ; When the Kellys were out 1923 ; Trooper OBrien 1928.

results.title: Badminton fundamentals
results.brief_description: This films intorduces the novuice to the basic rules of the increasingly popular sport of badminton. Illustrates what is needed to play the game, from the court used to the racquets and shuttlecocks and suggested attire (for the 1950s). It also demonstrates the rules of the game, how to play; handgrips, the various strokes and stances and tips for playing better.

results.title: Bad taste (D)
results.brief_description: Peter Jackson’s low budget feature debut originally began life as a 10 minute splatter film called “Roast of the day” but was then expanded into a feature, painstakingly shot over a period of four years worth of Sunday’s. The comedy/horror film which gave rise to the term splatstick proudly lives up to it’s bad taste title, offering many gross moments of extreme gore, inventively executed on it’s shoestring budget. The bare bones plot revolves a round a team of alien hunters (the Astro Investigation and Defence Service with the unfortunate acronym of AIDS), who have been sent into the sleepy New Zealand town of Kaihoro where a gang of nasty extra-terrestrials lead by the ghastly Lord Crumb, have taken over. Of course much blood and viscera is spilt as the team discover the aliens evil plan to turn the inhabitants of the town into food. Cast includes Terry Potter, Peter Jackson, Peter O’Herne, Craig Smith, Mike Minett and Doug Wren.

results.title: Bacteria and Health
results.brief_description: Diagrams and experiments show that by taking simple precautions such as disinfecting and dressing wounds, washing hands in soapy water and being aware of the presence of bacteria, we can remain healthy. It also discusses the ways in which our bodies cope with bacteria, and whether they are useful or harmful to the body.

results.title: Bacteria
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains external and internal structures, manner of feeding, reproductive processes, classifications, and the ecological importance of bacteria. Also shows cell division and conjugation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Backward civilisation
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Yale University
results.brief_description: A survey of the life among the Berber people of North Africa including aspects of their daily life such as their handcrafts, agricultural methods, customs and superstitions.

results.title: Backstage at the Kirov
results.brief_description: The splendour of ballet is for so many a world of dreams and miracles. This movie invites us to be part of the passion and dedication blended with the grinding agony of training and rehearsal at the backstage of the famous Kirov Theatre in Leningrad.

results.title: Background for reading: stories of Holland
results.brief_description: Views of Holland are used to provide a background to Dutch literature: views of windmills; canals; dairy farms and farm houses; fishing boats on the Zuyder Zee; old-fashioned costumes worn by the people; the dikes; tulip growing; views of the town of Leiden; Rembrandt’s studio and the old Church of St Peter’s.

results.title: Background for literature: The Lady of the lake
results.brief_description: Scottish scenes are used to illustrate excerpts from Sir Walter Scott’s poem “Lady of the lake”. The film, which includes a brief outline of the author’s life, is intended to demonstrate the concept that literature has its roots in actual places and people.
